players.name: Alice
memory: You're Alice, the villager.
Night 1 begins.
Bob was found dead.
Day 1 begins.
Charlie: "I am the detective. I investigated Diana last night — she is the mafioso. Vote to arrest Diana now."
You: "Charlie, that’s a big claim — can you explain what made you confident Diana is mafia? Also Diana, how do you respond to Charlie’s accusation?"
Diana: "Charlie, your quick certainty is suspicious — why reveal an investigation immediately instead of sharing details or using it later? I’m not surprised you’d point fingers so fast."

You: "Charlie, if you truly investigated Diana, why not give details (when did you visit, how did you test for mafia, any chance of false positives)? Quick claims can be faked. Diana, any alibi for last night?"

Diana: "Charlie, your claim is way too convenient — accusing me immediately after a night kill that benefits you feels staged. If you investigated me, provide specifics now (when, how, result details) or this looks like a setup to pin the town on me. Alice, we should ask Charlie to explain before we rush to vote."

Charlie: "I investigated Diana last night at 11pm. My investigation method is standard: I visited their room and my role check returned 'mafioso.' Bob was killed that night, which is consistent with mafia activity. I understand doubts, but I’m certain — vote Diana."
Votes: Alice voted for Diana, Charlie voted for Diana, Diana voted for Alice
Diana was arrested
